parts.text: {"word":"non-liability","priority":"☆☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"免責、責任がないこと、法的責任の不存在","english_definition":"the state of not being legally responsible for something; exemption from liability.","examples":[{"sentence":"The contract included a clause of non-liability for damages caused by natural disasters.","translation":"その契約には、自然災害による損害に対する免責条項が含まれていた。"},{"sentence":"The company claimed non-liability for the accident due to faulty equipment.","translation":"会社は、機器の故障による事故について免責を主張した。"},{"sentence":"The insurance policy provides non-liability coverage for certain types of claims.","translation":"その保険契約は、特定の種類の請求に対する免責範囲を提供している。"}],"collocations":["clause of non-liability (免責条項)","claim of non-liability (免責の主張)","agreement of non-liability (免責合意)","certificate of non-liability (免責証明書)"],"synonyms":["exemption","immunity","impunity","irresponsibility","freedom from liability"],"antonyms":["liability","responsibility","accountability","culpability"]}],"etymology":{"value":"「non-」（否定）+ 「liability」（法的責任）","priority":"★★★"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌnɒn laɪəˈbɪləti/","syllables":"non-li-a-bil-i-ty"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"non-liabilities"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"\"Non-liability\" refers to the condition of being free from legal responsibility or obligation. It often appears in legal contexts, contracts, and insurance policies. It is the opposite of \"liability,\" which means being legally responsible for something.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He has a non-liability for the debt.","correct":"✓ He has non-liability for the debt. / ✓ He has no liability for the debt.","note":"The phrase is \"non-liability for\" or \"no liability for.\" The article 'a' is not used before non-liability in this context."},{"incorrect":"✗ The non-liability is on the company.","correct":"✓ The non-liability rests with the company. / ✓ The company has non-liability.","note":"The correct phrasing is \"non-liability rests with\" or \"the company has non-liability.\""}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["nonliable (adjective): not liable"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"related_legal_terms":["waiver of liability","release of liability","hold harmless agreement","indemnity clause"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C2","frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"The term \"non-liability\" is a formal legal term that means someone is not legally responsible for something. It is commonly used in contracts, insurance policies, and legal documents to specify situations where a party is exempt from being held accountable for damages, losses, or other claims. Understanding this term is crucial in legal and business contexts to determine the extent of responsibility and protection.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The disclaimer stated the website had non-liability for any errors in the provided information.","translation":"免責事項には、ウェブサイトは提供された情報の誤りについて責任を負わないと記載されていた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"免責"},{"sentence":"The company sought non-liability by including a force majeure clause in the contract.","translation":"その会社は、契約に不可抗力条項を含めることで免責を求めた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"免責"},{"sentence":"The insurance policy provides non-liability coverage for damages caused by acts of war.","translation":"その保険契約は、戦争行為によって引き起こされた損害に対する免責範囲を提供している。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"免責"}]}
